thread.title: Kevin McCarthy drops out of speaker race
thread.title_full: Kevin McCarthy drops out of speaker race

author: Cheryl Chumley
title: Kevin McCarthy drops out of speaker race
text:
Kevin McCarthy drops out of speaker race 'Throws complete turmoil into this election' Published: 18 mins ago Cheryl Chumley About | Email | Archive Cheryl K. Chumley is a staff writer for WND and author of "Police State USA: How Orwell's Nightmare is Becoming our Reality." Formerly with the Washington Times, she is a journalism fellow with The Phillips Foundation in Washington, D.C., where she spent a year researching and writing about private property rights. Text bigger Rep. Kevin McCarthy (Credit: Wikipedia) 
Kevin McCarthy, the most talked about candidate to fill speaker John Boehner’s leadership post, dropped out in a shock announcement Thursday mornning. 
As Bret Baier, Fox News host commented: “This throws complete turmoil into this election.” 
The statement from McCarthy didn’t give much insight into his reasons. He simply said: “It is not my time.” But many on Capitol Hill said the more conservative wings of the House pressed for him to step down. 
So far, Rep. Daniel Webster and Rep. Jason Chaffetz are still seeking the speaker slot. 
The support for a new speaker seems to be tipping toward the more conservative side of the House. Speaker John Boehner stepped away from the role, in part because of all the tea party-type opposition he’s faced in the last couple years. 
Donald Trump tweeted: “Great. Kevin McCarthy’s dropped out of speaker’s race.” Text smaller
